We encourage you to help craft these de novo, refactor work recently done to help your team do the same. You will also have opportunity to lead/mentor other junior front-end engineers.



Bachelor’s degree required, preferably major in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or STEM related with strong software focus.

Title: Data Analyst I
Job_Description:
About the role:

The Business Analyst will provide expertise in data extraction, report creation / visualization, and analysis to support critical management decisions. This role will be tasked with the development of user-friendly metrics and dashboards for consumption by Senior Leadership and the Service Organization. The Business Analyst’s main focus will be on providing analytics and data visualization for service related KPIs, including staff utilization, inventory management, mean time between failure, and other critical service activities. The Business Analyst also provides support to the Finance team by applying statistical analysis, trending, and other visual insights around various strategic initiatives.

Title: Data Analyst I
Job_Description:
DUTIES:
Work with Site Leadership to identify and address areas of process improvement.
Drive cataloging of opportunities, quantification of opportunities, management of resources to capture data, coordination of ideation and project management to ensure execution of achievements.
Consolidate and analyze global inventory data for trends and reduction opportunities.
Establish and standardize global demand data for monthly operations reviews.
Conduct analysis across all CAD Business Units to find and lead SKU rationalization initiatives.
Collaborate across functions to ensure consistent implementation of new, improved processes.
Establish measurable criteria to ensure desired results are acquired and provide management with updates via tracking reports reflective of Key Performance Indicators in line with set priorities and timing targets.
Identify training needs for the facilities and assist in the deployment of agreed to training techniques, content, and timing.
Promote the transformation of a reactive organizational culture to one that is more proactive, utilizing data driven decision-making, and giving priority to preventative actions.
Train and educate the organization and to implement continuous improvement methodologies including PPI, 6 Sigma, 5S, Lean, OEE and others.
Review business process to improve efficiency and benchmark with industry Best Practices.


Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Engineering, Manufacturing, or related field of study plus 2 years of Data Analytics, or related experience.

Must have experience or knowledge of:
RCCMs, PPI, 6 Sigma, 5S, Lean, OEE, and other Continuous Improvement techniques and their application;
DMAIC principles: Define, Measure, Analyze, Improve, Control;
Successful supervisory experience within a manufacturing environment;
Leading programs/projects and managing teams;
Applied statistical models/engines;
Electronics, X-ray tube manufacturing or bench top manufacturing;
A variety of manufacturing areas (accounting, manufacturing, supply chain, logistics);
Product sourcing and delivery execution; and
Material flow through manufacturing sites.


Roving/Telecommuting Employee: Reports to company headquarters in Waltham, MA. Will work at various unknown client sites throughout the U.S. for up to 70% of the time. Must be willing to travel anywhere in the U.S. and may be assigned to work at client sites across the U.S. Can work remotely or telecommute.
